page.title: 05FAMILY - EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Elham School set out forms asking questions about families. On a graph, we recorded who went out of the village to work. Quite a few people did. Some people worked in the village and had self-employed jobs. Many people worked in Canterbury, less worked in Folkestone, then came Hythe, Ashford and lastly Dungerness and Deal. In 1980 the villagers made a survey of who went out of the village to work.{27% worked around Elham {26% Folkestone/Hythe {11% Canterbury {8% Ashford {7% London {6% Dover {5% Local villages {3% Other parts of Kent It appears in 1985, that more people work in{Canterbury.
